dt: {bc}a unique digital identifier that cannot be copied, substituted, or subdivided, that is recorded in a {d_link|blockchain|blockchain}, and that is used to certify authenticity and ownership (as of a specific digital asset and specific rights relating to it)

dt.t: What Mr. Estavi bought wasn't the tweet itself, but a non-fungible token, or {wi}NFT{/wi}, giving him a certificate of authenticity, license to display the tweet, and whatever bragging rights come along with it.
{wi}NFTs{/wi} are certificates of ownership of a unique digital item such as a video, recording, or cyber artwork. These digital receipts reside on the blockchain …

dt: {bc}the asset that is represented by an NFT

dt.t: Christie's sold the artwork as a {ldquo}non-fungible token{rdquo} ({wi}NFT{/wi}), a craze for which has gripped Silicon Valley's elite.
… an event ticket sold as an {wi}NFT{/wi} could be embedded with a predetermined time for a personal meet-and-greet with the founder of a company or a brand's celebrity spokesperson.

shortdef: a unique digital identifier that cannot be copied, substituted, or subdivided, that is recorded in a blockchain, and that is used to certify authenticity and ownership (as of a specific digital asset and specific rights relating to it)
the asset that is represented by an NFT
